  • HttpRequest

Interface HttpRequest

An HttpRequest is stack allocated and only accessible during the callback invocation.

Hierarchy

  • HttpRequest
  • Defined in index.d.ts:202

  • Returns the lowercased header value or empty string.

getMethod

  • getMethod(): string

  • Returns the lowercased HTTP method, useful for "any" routes.

    Returns string

  • getParameter(index: number): string

  • Returns the parsed parameter at index. Corresponds to route.

    Returns string

getQuery

  • getQuery(): string

  • Returns the raw querystring (the part of URL after ? sign) or empty string.

    Returns string

    • Defined in index.d.ts:214
  • getQuery(key: string): string

  • Returns a decoded query parameter value or empty string.

    Parameters

    • key: string

    Returns string

    • Defined in index.d.ts:216

getUrl

  • getUrl(): string

  • Returns the URL including initial /slash

    Returns string

    • Defined in index.d.ts:208

setYield

  • setYield(yield: boolean): HttpRequest

  • Setting yield to true is to say that this route handler did not handle the route, causing the router to continue looking for a matching route handler, or fail.

    Parameters

    • yield: boolean

    Returns HttpRequest

    • Defined in index.d.ts:220
